profile.name: Marcelo Santos
profile.headline: Software Engineer & Founder @ Monynha Softwares
profile.bio: Software engineer focused on digital products, automation, and DevOps. Passionate about accessibility, open-source, and inclusive design. Founder of Monynha Softwares ‚Äî a creative laboratory that unites technology, diversity, and digital art. Monynha Softwares was born from a collective dream: to prove that technology and affection can coexist, that innovation also comes from the margins, and that the web can be a space of welcoming, creation, and resistance. Our mission is clear: 'to democratize technology, combat hypocrisy, and give voice to those who create outside the norm.' In other words, we seek to transform what was once a privilege into an opportunity for everyone, ensuring that access to technological tools is not a luxury, but a right shared by all communities. Our vision for the future is an inclusive digital culture, where creativity and technological knowledge flourish in the peripheries as much as in the center, breaking down socioeconomic barriers and expanding opportunities for participation.

projects.name: BotecoPro
projects.summary: Management system for bars and restaurants with integrated AI to optimize operations and improve business efficiency.
projects.fullDescription: BotecoPro centralizes bar and restaurant operations with order automation, inventory management, and real-time dashboards. The AI layer recommends preventive actions, reduces waste, and empowers teams to deliver consistent experiences in every service.

projects.name: Boteco.pt
projects.summary: Multilingual institutional website (pt/en/es/fr) for BotecoPro, focused on performance, accessibility, and user experience.
projects.fullDescription: Boteco.pt is the digital showcase for BotecoPro, presenting management solutions for bars and restaurants. The site combines responsive design, progressive lazy loading, automated visual tests, and support for 4 languages. The architecture prioritizes Core Web Vitals, SEO, and WCAG accessibility, with an optimized bundle (75% reduction) and a customized design system with shadcn/ui.

thoughts.title: Inclusive Design and Technology
thoughts.excerpt: Technology is more human when it's made for everyone ‚Äî not just for those who have easy access to it.
thoughts.body:
I have always believed that design and accessibility are not opposite points on a spectrum, but two languages that, when they converse, translate the true meaning of innovation. Aesthetics are only complete when they are understandable. Beauty is only beautiful when it is accessible.

At Monynha Softwares, every interface is born from a simple principle: **empatia como arquitetura**. Creating is not just drawing pixels; it's understanding contexts, recognizing differences, and ensuring that no one is left out of the digital experience.

We implement adequate contrasts, clear visual hierarchies, and keyboard navigation from the first prototype. We avoid animations that may cause discomfort to motion-sensitive individuals, respecting `prefers-reduced-motion`. Every component is designed to be useful, not just beautiful.

More than just complying with WCAG standards, we treat accessibility as an expression of respect. Every *alt-text* is an invitation to inclusion; every *aria-label* is a coded gesture of empathy.

Inclusive design is not a competitive differentiator ‚Äî it is a political and ethical act. Because if technology is made by people, for people, then it must embrace all forms of existence. üíú

thoughts.title: Behind Monynha
thoughts.excerpt: More than software ‚Äî a movement of pride, diversity, and digital resistance.
thoughts.body:
Monynha Softwares was born from a collective dream: to prove that technology and affection can coexist. That innovation also comes from the margins. That the web can be a space of welcome, creation, and resistance.

The name carries this essence. *"Mona"*, word of resistance from Pajub√°, and the suffix *"-nynha"*, loving and peripheral expression, symbolize the mix of tenderness, humor, and courage that define who we are. We create with love, but also with purpose ‚Äî every project is a way of saying: **we are here and we are not going back into the technology closet.** üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà

Our manifesto is simple: **democratize the digital, celebrate difference, and hack the system with pride.** Through free software, accessible design, and diverse communities, we seek to transform what was once privilege into possibility.

From open-source apps and platforms to cultural and educational initiatives, every line of code written by Monynha is a gesture of creative resistance. Our products ‚Äî like BotecoPro, FACODI, and AssisTina ‚Äî are not just technological solutions; they are living manifestations of empathy, inclusion, and representation.

Being Monynha means understanding that technology is language, and language is power. That every person who sees themselves in a product is more than a user ‚Äî they are a protagonist. And that's why we continue to create, day after day, with the certainty that **diversity is also performance.** üíÖ‚ú®
